abstract: Federal appeals court in Richmond, Va, rules in favor of Gavin Grimm, transgender student born female who wants to use boys' restroom at his high school; civil rights advocates argue part of ruling also applies to North Carolina's contentious law limiting use of bathrooms by transgender people, in publicly-owned buildings, to birth gender; Human Rights Campaign is among organizations saying ruling means North Carolina now violates Title IX, federal law prohibiting gender discrimination in schools.
lead_paragraph: The court ordered a lower court to re-evaluate the case of Gavin Grimm, who had sought protection under Title IX in using the boys’ bathroom at his school.

headline.main: Appeals Court Favors Transgender Student in Virginia Restroom Case
headline.print_headline: Virginia Case on Restrooms Could Affect N. Carolina
